title: Electric potential and electric field - calculus

content.question: The electric potential <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis of a region of space is given as a function of position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> by the equation <math alttext="V equals k x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="k equals 3.0 volts per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The electric field at position <math alttext="x equals 3 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is equal to

choices.label: <math alttext="27.0 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="18 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="9.0 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 9 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9.0</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 18 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 18 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
